question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Donate()] [Line 59-64] [Scheme Manager Auth] ContributeProfits uses Context.Self as SchemeManager - if this contract doesn't have proper permissions in the profit scheme, does the call fail silently? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Donate()] [Line 41-42] [Silent Failure Path] IsTokenAvailableForMethodFee returns false causes early return with Empty() - no revert, no event, no error - can this be exploited to make users think donation succeeded? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Release()] [Line 107-108] [Integer Truncation] When dividing seconds by PeriodSeconds, does integer division truncate and potentially miscalculate the elapsed period count? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Release()] [Line 114-121] [No State Update] After successful DistributeProfits, no state is updated to mark distribution happened - can Release() be called again immediately with same isTimeToRelease condition? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: InitialProfitSchemeForSideChain()] [Line 27-32] [No Duplicate Check] CreateScheme.Send is called without checking if scheme already exists - can this create duplicate schemes or fail due to existing scheme conflict? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: InitialProfitSchemeForSideChain()] [Line 18-25] [Null Return Logic] If TokenHolderContract address is null, function logs and returns - but State.TokenHolderContract.Value remains uninitialized, breaking all future operations? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: GetUndistributedDividends()] [Line 154-158] [LINQ Performance] Select followed by ToDictionary creates intermediate collections - with many symbols, could this exceed gas limits in a view call? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: GetSideChainDividendPoolScheme()] [Line 167-168] [Cache Timing] SchemeId is cached from GetScheme result - if scheme is deleted and recreated with same Context.Self but different SchemeId, does cached value become stale? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: GetSideChainDividendPoolScheme()] [Line 171-174] [Generic Context.Call] Using Context.Call with generic type - if ProfitContract has breaking changes, does this call fail without proper error handling? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Global State: SideChainReceivedDividends] [State Storage] Is SideChainReceivedDividends ever cleaned up? If the chain runs for years, does storing dividends for every block height cause unbounded state growth? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Global State: TokenHolderContract.Value] [State Mutability] Once State.TokenHolderContract.Value is set in InitialProfitSchemeForSideChain, can it ever be updated? If TokenHolderContract needs migration, is the dividend pool stuck? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Donate()] [Composite Attack] Can an attacker combine: (1) donate malicious token that reverts on TransferFrom after passing IsTokenAvailableForMethodFee check, (2) lock the contract in failed state preventing legitimate donations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/AEDPoSContract_SideChainDividendsPool.cs] [Function: Donate() + Release()] [Economic Attack] Can an attacker donate dust amounts across many different symbols to increase ReceivedTokenSymbols size, making GetUndistributedDividends and Release() operations too gas-expensive to execute?
